metadata.title: CVE-2023-3212 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
A NULL pointer dereference issue was found in the gfs2 file system in theLinux kernel. It occurs on corrupt gfs2 file systems when the evict codetries to reference the journal descriptor structure after it has been freedand set to NULL. A privileged local user could use this flaw to cause akernel panic.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3212` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-218-generic - 4.15.0-218.229
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-218-generic - 4.15.0-218.229
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-218-lowlatency - 4.15.0-218.229
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-164-generic - 5.4.0-164.181~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-164-lowlatency - 5.4.0-164.181~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-218.229').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4, was needs-triage').
